content.prompt: By the early 1600s, which of the following had most changed the circumstances of villages such as Secotan in eastern North America?

choices.label: The establishment of permanent settlements by English colonists
The impact of epidemic diseases introduced by Europeans
The decline of the fur and beaver trades
The introduction of new foods into the Native American diet

topic.text: 1.4: Columbian Exchange, Spanish Exploration, and Conquest

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
